metadata.title: Amazon FreeRTOS and Trusted Secure IP on an RX65N

sections.content:
Question:
Can an RX65N having no TSIP module be used in an Amazon FreeRTOS environment that uses the TLS protocol? 
Answer:
Yes. It can.
If you use the Trusted Secure IP on Amazon FreeRTOS, the information at the following link should be helpful.
You will be able to obtain performance information and understand the implementation method.
Evaluation of performance of communication in the SSL TLS layer using the Security IP in an RX72N
For the general TLS implementation method and the method of linkage with the Trusted Secure IP driver, the application note at the following link should be helpful.
https://www.renesas.com/software-tool/trusted-secure-ip-driver
-> Trusted Secure IP driver (binary version) for RX-family products
-> In the case of Rev.1.13
-> \r20an0548xx0113-lib-rx-tsip-security\reference_documents\ja\r01an5880jj0100-rx-tsip.pdf
  Suitable Products
RX65N
